net.adamcin.commons.jcr.batch

Class DefaultBatchSession

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.adamcin.commons.jcr.batch.DefaultBatchSession
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Session, BatchSession

    public final class DefaultBatchSession
extends Object
implements BatchSession
    Default implementation of the BatchSession interface. This is quite a massive class due to the complexity of the JCR Session, Node, and Property interfaces

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface javax.jcr.Session

    • Method Detail

      • disableSessionSave

        public boolean disableSessionSave()
        Description copied from interface: BatchSession
        Ignore calls to session saves. Useful for suppressing save calls in API's that are agnostic to this interface. Call BatchSession.enableSessionSave() to re-enable Session.save()
        Specified by:
        disableSessionSave in interface BatchSession
        Returns:
        true if this call changed the state from enabled to disabled

      • enableSessionSave

        public boolean enableSessionSave()
        Description copied from interface: BatchSession

        Specified by:
        enableSessionSave in interface BatchSession
        Returns:
        true if this call changed the state from disabled to enabled

      • disableAutoSave

        public boolean disableAutoSave()
        Description copied from interface: BatchSession
        Disables autoSave even when the batchSize is exceeded. Call BatchSession.enableAutoSave() to re-enable autoSaves.
        Specified by:
        disableAutoSave in interface BatchSession
        Returns:
        true if this call changed the state from enabled to disabled

        Returns:

      • commit

        public void commit()
            throws RepositoryException
        Description copied from interface: BatchSession
        Immediately re-enables session saves and autoSaves, and then saves any uncommitted changes. Should be called by client code after all changes have been processed for the given JCR session.
        Specified by:
        commit in interface BatchSession
        Throws:
        RepositoryException

      • purge

        public void purge(String path)
           throws RepositoryException
        Description copied from interface: BatchSession
        Recursively removes the subgraph of Nodes and related Version Nodes, descending from path, by traversing depth-first to the leaves and removing each node on the way up. Versions are marked for removal, but are only removed after a session save because version modifications are workspace-write operations, not session-write operations.
        Specified by:
        purge in interface BatchSession
        Parameters:
        path - the node at the top of the subgraph
        Throws:
        RepositoryException - if anything goes wrong

        Parameters:

      • getBatchSize

        public int getBatchSize()
        Specified by:
        getBatchSize in interface BatchSession
        Returns:
        the currently configured batch size

      • setBatchSize

        public void setBatchSize(int batchSize)
        Description copied from interface: BatchSession
        The batch size determines when the BatchSession will auto-save. When a change is made using this session proxy, it will check to see if the number of paths with uncommitted changes matches or exceeds the batch size to determine if an auto-save is necessary. The default batch size is 1024 nodes.
        Specified by:
        setBatchSize in interface BatchSession

      • getTotalSaves

        public int getTotalSaves()
        Specified by:
        getTotalSaves in interface BatchSession
        Returns:
        the number of saves committed by this session since instantiation

        Returns:

        Returns:
        the set of paths that have uncommitted changes according to this BatchSession
